Hello, I've been long diagnosed bipolar II (since a preteen) I've tried many medications with awful outcomes - escitalopram has been the only thing that has ever helped. I started out on 10 mg which was eventually increased to 20 mg which I continue to take to this day. My disaster plan with my doctor is to start quetiapine once daily along with my escitalopram which has worked great. This plan has kept me out of the hospital and psych ward. My only complaint about escitalopram is the sexual dysfunction side effect. I am lucky that I am still able to achieve orgasm but it takes 4x as long as I do unmedicated. I know this is such an awful side effect but you have to look at the pros and cons... don't give up on your medication for a partner.
